file_content.text: Uh, heh... I'm really not looking for any trouble. I've already bought all I can afford today....
All right, all right! I get it--you're tough! Don't hurt me. I'm not armed. I'm just a starship salesman!
For the last time... where's my starship?
Then let's talk ships.
That mean machine Skavak brought to Coruscant? I've been taking really good care of it.
That hunk of junk barely made it to Coruscant. First thing Skavak did when he got here was trade it in.
That just means you're an even bigger thief than Skavak.
Salesman?
I'm just trying to earn a living. It was none of my business where Skavak got that ship, so I never asked.
Why would Skavak need to buy a starship after he stole mine?
What are you doing here?
He's shopping for upgrades. Nobody in their right mind would replace that sweet ride of yours.
Listen, your ship's in great shape. All the cargo is still on board. Even had it detailed. No harm done, right?
Not yet--but you owe the captain something for all her trouble.
Not yet--but you owe the captain something for all his trouble.
I could give you a nice ship upgrade and charge it to Skavak's account. Interested?
What are my options?
Show me all you've got.
I carry the finest starship upgrades. You won't find a better deal on Coruscant, or my name's not Fabizan.
As long as Skavak's paying, I'm buying.
Very interested.
It's nice to have friends with money, isn't it?
How much to see you dead?
Wait, wait! Give me a chance to make this right! Please?
Let's be honest. That flying garbage heap was on its last thrusters.
Hate to tell you this, but your old ship was worth more as parts. Skavak had me chop it up and sell it off.
You chopped up my ship?
What?
We... we were very gentle, I promise.
I hope I got a lot for it.
What was my profit?
I made out alright--uh, I mean, you made out great!
What do you suppose you're worth as parts?
I should do the same to you.
Whoa, whoa, whoa! I'm not worth anything in pieces.
Your ship is gone, but I still have the cargo from it. Skavak paid me to keep everything in storage.
He also pre-paid for a new starship, but never picked out a design. How about I let you take it?
I've been waiting for this payback a long time.
Revenge is sweet.
You come out ahead on this deal, my friend. That old ship of yours was a flying death trap.
Now that's a deal I can't turn down.
It's more than fair.
See? I knew we could come to an arrangement. I pride myself on fair deals that respect the customer.
I might just have to let you live.
You're saving your neck.
I love it when my customers are happy. You're happy, right? Please be happy.
See that terminal? It's got my complete catalog on it. Pick whatever you want.
You move an inch, and I'll blast you.
Don't so much as twitch.
I can spend hours looking through catalogs. Hope that's alright.
This may take a while.
If I don't find anything that suits me, I'll be very unhappy.
I'd better like the selection.
Take all the time you want. I'll make sure your cargo is safely secured before the ship's delivered.
Do I work fast or what? All your cargo is accounted for and waiting in the hold, even the special stuff.
You're gonna let Fabizan scoot along now, right? I've got other business far, far away from here.
Beat it before I shoot you.
Get out of here.
Then get to it.
By the way, your ship has a top-quality refresher. Might want to spend a few minutes getting rid of that smell, huh?
May this ship bring you many fine years of service. If you encounter any problems, please contact the manufacturer.
I'm out of here. Thanks for not killing me!
Die, you little creep.
No, you don't. [Attack]
Aw, come on! How is this fair?
Whoa, you smell like a Hutt's kitchen. How'd you think you were gonna sneak up on us with that body odor?
That smell was your warning to run.
I'm not sneaking. [Attack]
Excuse me, but in case it wasn't obvious by the locked door you sliced through, this is a private docking bay.
Three words, pal. Where's... my... ship?
There should be a ship here.
I don't know you, and I sure don't have your ship.
What are you doing here?
Me? I'm just a humble merchant waiting for his buyer, and that ain't you.
Skavak said there might be a troublemaker or two dropping by. He paid extra for security to take care of it.
Boys, like the man says, the customer's always right. You know what to do.
It's my docking bay, now.
Not any more. [Attack]
Boys! Shoot this lunatic!
